Module org.example._50zo
Package Model.Exceptions

Class InvalidCardException

java.lang.Object
java.lang.Throwable
java.lang.Exception
Model.Exceptions.InvalidCardException
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable
public class InvalidCardException extends Exception
Exception thrown when a player attempts to play a card that would cause the pile value to exceed the maximum allowed value of 50. This exception is a core part of the game's rule enforcement mechanism, preventing invalid moves and maintaining game integrity. This exception captures comprehensive information about the invalid play attempt, including: The card that was attempted to be played The current pile value before the attempt The resulting value that would exceed the limit The exception provides both a basic error message (via Throwable.getMessage()) and a detailed, user-friendly message (via getDetailedMessage()) that can be displayed to players to explain why their move was rejected.
Since:
2025

  • Constructor Details

    • InvalidCardException

      public InvalidCardException(Card card, int currentPileValue)
      Constructs a new InvalidCardException with detailed information about the invalid play. The exception message is automatically formatted in Spanish to include the card symbol, card value, current pile value, and the resulting value that exceeds 50. The resulting value is calculated as the sum of the current pile value and the attempted card's value.
      Parameters:
      card - the card that cannot be played due to exceeding the pile limit
      currentPileValue - the current value of the pile before the attempted play

  • Method Details

    • getAttemptedCard

      public Card getAttemptedCard()
      Returns the card that was attempted to be played.
      Returns:
      the attempted card that caused the exception

    • getCurrentPileValue

      public int getCurrentPileValue()
      Returns the value of the pile before the invalid play attempt.
      Returns:
      the current pile value at the time of the exception

    • getResultingValue

      public int getResultingValue()
      Returns the value that would result from playing the attempted card. This value is the sum of the current pile value and the attempted card's value, and it exceeds the maximum allowed value of 50.
      Returns:
      the resulting value (current pile value + attempted card value)

    • getDetailedMessage

      public String getDetailedMessage()
      Returns a detailed, user-friendly message in Spanish describing why the card is invalid. This message is formatted for display to players and includes all relevant information about the failed play attempt. The message includes: The symbol of the invalid card The current pile value The value of the attempted card What the resulting value would be The maximum allowed value (50)
      Returns:
      a formatted string with detailed information about the invalid play, suitable for display to the player
